Examples.name: Forward Propagation - OpenSees
Examples.description: This example illustrates how quoFEM interacts with the Tcl interpreter for OpenSees. A simple forward propagation procedure is run to estimate the first and second central moments of a FE model's response, given the marginal distributions of various random parameters.

Examples.name: Forward Propagation - OpenSeesPy
Examples.description: This example illustrates how quoFEM interacts with OpenSeesPy. A simple forward propagation procedure is run to estimate the first and second central moments of a FE model's response, given the marginal distributions of various random parameters.

Examples.name: Basic Modeling with Python
Examples.description: This example illustrates how Python scripting can be used with quoFEM to express general mathematical models without the use of a dedicated finite element analysis engine.

Examples.name: Forward Propagation - Multiple FEM Models
Examples.description: This example illustrates how multiple finite element models could be used to estimate the first amd second central moments of a response given two different finite element models of the system.

Examples.name: Deterministic Calibration
Examples.description: In this example, a **parameter estimation** routine is used to solve a classical optimization problem for which an analytic solution is known.

Examples.name: Reliability Analysis
Examples.description: This example uses quoFEM to perform a second-order reliability analysis (SORM) of an OpenSees FE model.

Examples.name: Sensitivity Analysis
Examples.description: This example uses quoFEM to perform a global sensitivity analysis of an OpenSees FE model.

Examples.name: Steel Frame: Bayesian Calibration with DREAM
Examples.description: In this example, Bayesian estimation is used to estimate column stiffnesses of a simple steel frame, given data about its mode shapes and mass distribution.

Examples.name: Steel Frame: Bayesian Calibration using TMCMC
Examples.description: In this example, Bayesian estimation is used to estimate the lateral story stiffnesses of the two stories of a simple steel frame, given data about its mode shapes and frequencies. The transitional Markov chain Monte Carlo algorithm is used to obtain samples from the posterior probability distribution of the lateral story stiffnesses

Examples.name: Steel Frame: Deterministic Calibration
Examples.description: In this example, a parameter estimation routine is used to estimate column stiffnesses of a simple steel frame, given data about its mode shapes and mass distribution.

Examples.name: Surrogate Modeling for One Story Building Earthquake Response
Examples.description: This example constructs a Gaussian process-based surrogate model for the response of a building structure given a ground motion time history. We are interested in the maximum inter-story drift/acceleration response determined in 14 structural parameters.

Examples.name: Surrogate Modeling to Predict Mean and Variance of Earthquake Response
Examples.description: This example constructs a Gaussian process-based surrogate model for the mean and variance of building responses subjected to ten different ground motions. A floor response of a six-story shear building model is investigated.

Examples.name: Two-Dimensional Truss: Global Sensitivity Analysis using SimCenterUQ Engine
Examples.description: A global sensitivity analysis is conducted with correlated random variables using the SimCenterUQ engine for sensitivity analysis.

Examples.name: Material Model: Bayesian Calibration with TMCMC
Examples.description: In this example, Bayesian estimation is used to calibrate the parameters values of a material model subjected to cyclic strain history.

Examples.name: Material Model: Deterministic Calibration
Examples.description: In this example, non-linear least squares minimization is used to calibrate the parameters values of a material model subjected to cyclic strain history.

Examples.name: Two-Dimensional Truss: PLoM Modeling and Simulation
Examples.description: In this example, the goal is to demonstrate the use of PLoM model method to predict the response of the example truss under the given load.

Examples.name: Global Sensitivity Analysis for Field QoI
Examples.description: In this example, the global sensitivity analysis is demonstrated for field QoI quantities. To gain efficiency dealing with high-dimension outputs, principal component analysis and probability model-based global sensitivity analysis (PCA-PSA) method is used in the analysis.

Examples.name: Heteroscedastic Gaussian Process
Examples.description: The Heteroscedastic Gaussian process model is trained based on partial replication strategy

Examples.name: Bayesian Calibration of Hierarchical Model
Examples.description: In this example, a material model is fitted to each of several datasets, and a probability model is fitted to the estimated parameters of the material model from the different datasets.
